data.Subject: EasyReport Starter Kit subscription confirmation
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %} {% markdown p_style: test_style %}

Hello {{ contact.name }},

Somebody (we hope it was you) subscribed your e-mail ({{ contact.email }}) to EasyReport Starter Kit (ERSK) newsletter.

In case it was not you, or if you decided not to receive such an information for any reason, you may unsubscribe at any time - just click the following link: unsubscribe here.

This messaged is aimed to confirm that your subscription is activated. But not only that. As promised, we give you a 10% discount* on ERSK Company License.

Just go to order page and apply the following coupon: ERSKLNCH10

Purchase Now

Please note, that purchasing an EasyReport Starter Kit license, you also get licenses for EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core and EasyQuery.JS at the same time.

Kind regards, EasyReport Starter Kit team
{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: Subscription renewal for {{ product.name }}
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

Your software maintenance subscription for {{ product.name }} has been extended till {{ license.expired }}.

You can access the Client Area section of our website (https://korzh.com/account) to get the keys for the latest versions of the product or to download the assets available for your type of license (source code or additional tools).

Thank you for using our service.

--
Best regards, {{ product.name }} team
https://korzh.com

data.Subject: Korzh.com blog newsletter - subscription confirmation
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %} {% markdown p_style: test_style %}

Hello {{ contact.name }},

Somebody (we hope it was you) subscribed your e-mail ({{ contact.email }}) to Korzh.com Blog newsletter.

This messaged is aimed to confirm that your subscription is activated. We promise not to spam you with useless messages - only notifications about new blog posts.

In case it was not you, or if you decided not to receive such an information for any reason, you may unsubscribe at any time - just click the following link: unsubscribe here.

As a bonus we give you a 10% discount coupon to all Korzh.com products.

Here it is: KRHBLOG10

You can apply it on the order page after selecting the product and the license type.

We hope you will find our blog articles useful. Good luck!

Kind regards, Korzh.com team
{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: EasyQuery.NET 5.4.1 + EasyQuery.JS 6.1.0 release
EasyQuery Black Friday Sale. 35% off
EasyQuery: let us know what you think
data.Content:
{% assign text_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px; margin-block-start: 1em; margin-block-end: 1em;' %} {% markdown p_style: text_style, li_style: text_style %}

Hello {{ contact.name }},

You signed up for EasyQuery framework trial some time ago. We appreciate it a lot. May we ask you to share your experience with us?

The survey has only 3 questions, and it will take no more than 2 minutes of your time.


Start the survey

Thank you in advance!

NB: And of course you can always contact our support team if you have any questions or suggestions regarding EasyQuery.
Kind regards, EasyQuery team

data.Subject: EasyQuery: how is the trial going?
data.Content:
{% assign text_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px; margin-block-start: 1em; margin-block-end: 1em;' %} {% markdown p_style: text_style, li_style: text_style %}

Hello {{ contact.name }},

We hope your EasyQuery trial is going well, and you have managed to implement the necessary scenario in your project, or to build a proof-of-concept application to show your employer or clients.

However, in case you have any trouble with your implementation - we are here to help.

  • First of all, we would like to remind about the Help page in your account on Korzh.com.

    It contains detailed step-by-step instructions on how to choose one of the scenarios implemented in our sample projects, and to copy the same behavior to your own.

  • Also, you can always contact us with a support request in case you have any problems with the framework.

In addition, here are a few links you might find useful:

  • EasyQuery.NET documentation home page
  • EasyQuery.JS documentation home page
  • EasyQuery Getting started articles
  • Working with data models
Kind regards, EasyQuery team
{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: EasyQuery version {{ version }} release
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %}
{% markdown p_style: test_style %}

Dear {{ contact.name }}

We would like to let you know about a minor update of EasyQuery library, version {{ version }} 
Both EasyQuery .NET packages and JS scripts were updated and have the synchronized version number. 

As usual, we highly recommend upgrading to the new version to keep your codebase up to date.   
Since it's a minor update, there are no breaking changes and so, you just need to update EasyQuery NuGet packages in your .NET projects 
and the version of EasyQuery.JS script on your pages (here is the direct link to the new script: https://cdn.korzh.com/eq/{{ version }}/eq.enterprise.min.js)

If you are using EasyQuery.JS NPM packages (@easyquery/...), you also need to update their versions to {{ version }} in your package.json file 
and run `npm install` command after that.
Don't forget to upgrade the version of EasyData packages (@easydata/...) to the latest one ({{ edVersion }}) as well.

All [our examples](https://github.com/easyquery/DotNetSamples) were upgraded to {{ version }} already

Here is the [Changelog](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/changelog) document that contains the detailed list changes in the latest update and all previous ones.

Please [let us know](https://korzh.com/support) if you have any questions or comments about this release.

--    
Kind regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery

{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: EasyQuery Halloween Sale. 20% off
Easy Report Starter Kit first steps
Support Ukraine against Russian invasion
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %}
{% markdown p_style: test_style %}

Dear {{ contact.name }},

We really wanted to write you about [the latest updates and new features in our products](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/version-7-2). 
Instead, we ought to cry for your help in our fight against the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

## What happened

On February 24th, with the help of Belarus, the Russian Army invaded Ukraine with aviation, artillery, and missiles. 
Cities and civilians - children, women, and elder people - are being bombed, with battles happening across Ukrainian cities. 
No preliminary demands or ultimatums were made.

The number of victims among the civilian population has already exceeded 350 people, among them - more than 20 children. 
More than 2,000 civilians got injuries. And this number is growing every hour. 
It’s clear that Russia won't stop until faced heavy losses due to strong military resistance.

## Why it's important

Ukraine is on the frontline, defending Europe and democracy itself. 
Our Army and volunteer battalions are strong and determined, but they are still under-equipped. 
Civilians are stopping the tanks with bare hands to help the army and territorial defense forces. 
That's why now we need your support to cover the real-time needs of defending Ukraine more than ever.

## How you can help

### 1. Share the truth

People of the world should know more about this situation and get full information about war crimes and atrocities of the Russian military.
Visit [#StandWithUkraine](https://ukraine.ua/news/stand-with-ukraine/) resource that contains links to the websites and social network accounts of all main Ukrainian institutions.

### 2. Donate to Ukrainian Army and volunteers

You can make a transfer to the [official fundraising account of the National Bank of Ukraine](https://bank.gov.ua/en/news/all/natsionalniy-bank-vidkriv-spetsrahunok-dlya-zboru-koshtiv-na-potrebi-armiyi) (in any currency) 
or the biggest foundation providing help to the Ukrainian Armed Forces - [__Come Back Alive (CBA)__](https://www.comebackalive.in.ua/)

### 3. Reach out to your authorities and governments.

Ukraine needs any kind of help and it needs it right now to break the backbone of the Russian war machine and prevent more deaths among civilians.

First of all, we ask for defensive weapons, ammunition, equipment, and medicine but, of course, any kind of help will be greatly appreciated!

--    
Best regards, [Korzh.com](https://korzh.com) team

{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: Your account on Korzh.com
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

A new account on Korzh.com was successfully created for you. 
If you didn't create it yourself then most possibly it was created by a license owner of one of our products to provide you an access to that license.
In this case, you will get another email about that soon.

To access your account please open the following URL in your browser: 
http://korzh.com/account 

You can log in using e-mail address ({{ contact.email }}) as a user name.
Your password: @Account.Password (can be changed later).

After logging in you will see a client's panel with your profile information and all licenses associated with your account.

Feel free to contact us using Support link on our website with any questions.

--
Best regards, Korzh.com team
https://korzh.com

data.Subject: Updated Privacy Policy
data.Content:
Updated Privacy Policy

Dear {{ contact.name }},

On 25 May 2018, the new General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) takes effect. The GDPR gives individuals in the European Union more control over how personal data is used.

In order to comply the GDPR requirements, we updated our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use. Please take the time to review our updated policies.

For all questions about these policies or for the requests about exporting your profile data or removing your account, you may contact us.

Please click the button below to update your email preferences:

Update email preferences

We also strongly encourage you to revise your personal data and email subscriptions in order to make all necessary changes, if that may be the case. You may do it on Korzh.com client's area page.

Best regards, Korzh.com team.
https://korzh.com

© 2018, Korzh.com
You received this message as a registered user of Korzh.com website.
This is one time email, you don't need to do anything in order to unsubscribe.

data.Subject: Aistant - a smart help center for your product. 50% discount for EasyQuery users
data.Content:
Hello, {{ contact.name }},

This is Sergiy Korzh, head of EasyQuery project.

As you probably noticed already, EasyQuery documentation has been completely renewed recently, got a new style, advanced search, and navigation.

It became possible because of our new project - Aistant which is designed to reduce the burden on your support team. Therefore, we would like to invite you to try it yourself.

WE OFFER:

Branded help center

Custom domain /
in-site integration

AI-powered search

... and many other features.

Try aistant

Registration in Aistant is free (no credit card required). For EasyQuery users, we offer a Premium subscription for the first year with a twice smaller price ($49 only!). This offer is limited in time. The price will increase as soon as we add new functionality to the service.

For all .NET developers, we also provide a special tool which allows you to publish the documentation for your C# code in a few minutes. Here is a detailed tutorial for this task.

Your feedback is highly appreciated and will help us to improve the service to better suit your needs.

Best regards,
Sergiy Korzh,
Head of EasyQuery, CEO at Aistant

data.Subject: EasyReport Starter Kit - new product from EasyQuery team
data.Content:
Hello {{ contact.name }},

We've just released a new product and would like to share the joy with you.

Why should you care?

As a user of EasyQuery library, you for sure understand the power of adhoc reporting applications and the benefits they bring to customers.

EasyReport Starter Kit (or ERSK) makes it much easier to create such solutions.

What is ERSK?

Have you ever seen our Easy.Report service? (you definitely have to, if you have not yet).

EasyReport Starter Kit is an ASP.NET Core solution template for creating web-application that behaves like Easy.Report. Inother words, it is a great starting point for your own solution for adhoc reporting.

What benefits you can get with ERSK?

We built ERSK with the best architectural principles and practices in mind. Both multi-tenant and single-tenant applications are supported. Your users will be able to work with any of the most popular databases: SQL Server, MySQL, Postgre SQL, Oracle or SQLite.

So, using ERSK saves your time and money. Instead of creating everything from scratch, you get a ready-to-use solution built on proven architecture and patterns.

How to get EasyReport Starter Kit?

If you already own a Company license for ASP.NET Core edition of EasyQuery - you are lucky! Your license already includes ERSK at no extra charges. You can get it right now from the Downloads section of your account on Korzh.com.

Otherwise, you just need to upgrade your license to Company - and voila! - you get the ERSK thereby. To make you lucky too, we provide a 50% discount * for such an upgrade. Contact us now to get the discount.

* This offer expires on May 1st, 2020.

Request 50% discount

Do you really need it?

We don't know.

But you may try to play with Easy.Report service. It's free. You can connect it to your testing DB to see how it works with your data. And then you may decide - do you want to build such an application for your customers? Do you want to spend a lot of resources on this? Or do you want to pay once, and get it right now, ready to use?

Simple choice.

Kind regards,
EasyQuery team

data.Subject: EasyReport Starter Kit - new product from EasyQuery team
data.Content:

We built ERSK with the best architectural principles and practices in mind. Both multi-tenant and single-tenant applications are supported. Your users will be able to work with any of the most popular databases: SQL Server, MySQL, Postgre SQL, Oracle or SQLite.

So, using ERSK saves your time and money. Instead of creating everything from scratch, you get a ready-to-use solution built on proven architecture and patterns.

How to get EasyReport Starter Kit?

Simple answer - to purchase it.

BUT! As a license owner of EasyQuery you may get an enormous 65% discount for ERSK *.

Please note, that the ERSK license also includes the licenses for EasyQuery ASP.NET Core and EasyQuery.JS. So, if you planned to upgrade your current ASP.NET application to ASP.NET Core - that's a good time to get a proper edition of EasyQuery for that.

* This offer expires on May 1st, 2020.

Get It Now with 65% discount

Do you really need it?

But you may try to play with Easy.Report service. It's free. You can connect it to your testing DB to see how it works with your data. And then you may decide - do you want to build such an application for your customers? Do you want to spend a lot of resources on this? Or do you want to pay once, and get it right now, ready to use?

Simple choice.

Kind regards,
EasyQuery team

data.Subject: Your access to license for {{ product.name }}
data.Content:
Hello {{ contact.name }},

You have been granted access to {{ product.name }} license (most possibly by license owner).

Now you can download full (unprotected) version of {{ product.name }} from our website and submit support requests regarding the product.

To access your account please open https://korzh.com/account in your browser and log in using your e-mail address ({{ contact.email }}) as user name and the password we sent to you previously.

Use "Downloads" section to get full version of {{ product.name }}.
Use "Tickets" page to track your support requests and to submit a new one.

Feel free to contact us with any questions about our product(s).

--
Best regards, Korzh.com team
https://korzh.com

data.Subject: Information regarding the registration of {{ license.name }}
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

Thank you for purchasing {{ license.name }}. We hope it will be useful to you.

To remove all demo version limitations you should download the full (unprotected) version of {{ license.name }} from our website and install it on your computer.

To access your account please open the following URL in your browser: 

https://korzh.com/account?a={{ contact.token }} 

NB: you will need to set your password on the first login.

After that just go to "Downloads" section and click on the necessary item to download it.
Use the procedure described above to get an update of the product in the future.
You can also access "Client's area" to manage your account, modify personal information (e-mail, address, etc.), change the password, 
access your licenses, and renew your subscriptions.

Feel free to contact us any questions regarding our product(s) using "Contact/Support" form on our website.

Your suggestions and bug reports are welcome. They can help us to make this product more useful and bug-free. 

--
Best regards, {{ license.name }} team
https://korzh.com

data.Subject: Information regarding the registration of {{ license.name }}
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %} {% markdown p_style: test_style %} Dear {{ contact.name }}, Thank you for purchasing {{ license.name }}. We hope it will be useful to you. Below are instructions on how to make use of your new license. ## 1. Your access to Client's Area on Korzh.com The Client's Area on our website contains the list of the licenses you own, the current status of all maintenance subscriptions, and the access to product keys and downloads. To access the Client's Area please use the button below:

Visit Client Area

## 2. License Key(s) for {{ license.name }}. To remove all demo version limitations you will need to apply the product key(s) that are listed on Client's Area dashboard or License Details pages. data.Subject: EasyQuery version 3.9.0 release
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

We are glad to announce version 3.9.0 release for our EasyQuery library.
This update includes a few new features in ASP.NET edition of EasyQuery as well as some enhancements in other editions and in Data Model Editor. 
You may find more detailed list of changes here: https://korzh.com/easyquery/release-notes/version-3.9.0

To make an upgrade just sign in to the Client Area on our website (https://korzh.com/account) and download the latest version.

For more detailed upgrade instructions please read:
http://docs.korzh.com/common/get-the-latest-version

Feel free to contact us with any question regarding new version and upgrade process.

--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com

P.S.
This message was sent to you since you are a registered user of {{ product.name }}.   
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/unsubscribe?email={{ contact.email }}

data.Subject: EasyQuery now supports .NET Core
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

There are a few updates in EasyQuery product line we would like to share with you.

1. New edition: EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core 
We are glad to introduce the new edition: EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core (short version: “EasyQuery ANC”). Using this edition you are able to build ASP.NET Core applications.
You can test how it works using new samples projects published on GitHub: https://github.com/easyquery/AspNetCoreSamples

2. 80% discount for new edition
As a registered user of EasyQuery you can get new EasyQuery ANC with incredible 80% discount! Just open the link and sign-in to your account: 
https://korzh.com/login?ReturnUrl=/easyquery/purchase
Hurry up - this offer will expire on the 1st of August!

3. Version 4.0 branch
In order to manage versions better, we divided  EasyQuery into two branches: “Version 3.x” and “Version 4.x”.
EasyQuery for .NET Core got version number 4.0.
All other editions of EasyQuery still remain with version 3.x branch (the latest version is 3.8.0). We are going to move them into Version 4.x branch eventually but version 3.x of EasyQuery will be still developed and maintained for the next 1-2 years at least.

So, you don't need to switch to the new version if you don't work with ASP.NET Core.
And you can use both regular .NET editions and .NET Core edition simultaneously in different projects.
 

For more information about new edition please read EasyQuery 4.0 release notes: https://korzh.com/easyquery/release-notes/version-4.0
 
--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library.
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/unsubscribe?email={{ contact.email }}

data.Subject: EasyQuery 4.2 and EasyQuery.JS releases
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

There are a few updates in EasyQuery product line we would like to share with you.

1. Version 4.2.0 of EasyQuery
A minor update of EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core which includes some new features both in server-side and client-side code as well as the fixes of the bugs found in the previous version.
For more information about the changes please read the Release Notes: https://korzh.com/easyquery/release-notes/version-4.2.0

2. EasyQuery.JS release
It's not a totally new product actually. Before this release, EasyQuery.JS was (and still is) a part of EasyQuery for ASP.NET/ASP.NET Core library. Now it's available as a separate product which can be used with any server-side platform or framework like PHP, Node.JS, Java, etc.
For more information - please read: https://korzh.com/easyquery/javascript/release-notes/easyqueryjs-first-public-release

NB: Of course you don't need to worry about this new product if you use ASP.NET (Core) edition of EasyQuery. With the latest version (4.2.0) you already have all functionality of EasyQuery.JS.  
However, perhaps there are other development teams in your company and these teams work with other development platforms (like Node.js, PHP, etc). So, we hope they may be interested to know that EasyQuery capabilities are now available to them too.
--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library.
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/unsubscribe?email={{ contact.email }}

data.Subject: EasyQuery 4.4.2 release
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

We are glad to announce the release of version 4.4.2 of EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core.

Since the version 4.3.1, we added the support for .NET 2.1 and 2.2, redesigned FilterBar widget and made a lot of small improvements and fixes.
More information about the changes you can find in the "Release Notes" section on our website:  
https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/

--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library (or corresponding product)

data.Subject: Announcing EasyQuery ASP.NET Core 5.0 release candidate
data.Content:
Hello {{ contact.name }},

We have 2 news for you:

1. We prepared a major upgrade of EasyQuery for ASP.NET
We are glad to announce the EasyQuery ASP.NET Core 5.0 RC2 (Release Candidate 2) which is the last preview version before releasing the final one: 5.0 RTM.
Version 5.0 - is a major update with a totally redesigned JavaScript part and significantly rewritten core (server-side) packages. 
The main goal with version 5.0 was to simplify the use of EasyQuery in SPA projects with frameworks like Angular, React or Vue. 

For more information about the new functionality provided with this update and the most significant changes please read the "release notes" article on our website:
https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/version-5-0-release-notes

2. 70% discount for current users!
As a current user of EasyQuery you probably already thought about porting your project to the ASP.NET Core platform. 
Today you have a good opportunity to reduce your expenses on such an upgrade. We offer you a massive 70% discount for EasyQuery ASP.NET Core edition.
The offer is valid until May 1st, 2019. To get the discount just visit EasyQuery Licensing page (https://korzh.com/easyquery/licensing), press "Buy now" on the selected license type and use the following coupon code on the order page: EQ50OTED

--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library (or corresponding product)
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/account/emailprefs?a={{ contact.email }}Hash

data.Subject: Announcing EasyQuery 5.0 release candidate
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }}

No doubt, EasyQuery library works well in classic ASP.NET Core applications which use MVC views or Razor pages.
However, you might have difficulties using it in the modern SPA projects with frameworks like Angular, React or Vue. 

That is one of the main reasons why we spent last few months working on a major update of EasyQuery - version 5.0.
In this update the JavaScript part was totally redesigned, and the core (server-side) packages were significantly rewritten.

So, today we’re announcing the EasyQuery 5.0 RC2 (Release Candidate 2) which is the last preview release before releasing the final version 5.0 RTM.

For more information about the new functionality provided with this major update and the most significant changes please read the "release notes" article on our website:
https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/version-5-0-release-notes

We also have published a sample solution for version 5.0 on GitHub:
https://github.com/easyquery/AspNetCoreSamples/tree/version-5.0


NB:
To share the joy of this event with you we offer a 50% discount for software maintenance renewal of EasyQuery.
The offer is valid until May 1st, 2019. So, hurry up if your subscription is expired or is about to expire soon.
All you need to that is to access your account and click on Renew link there. Here is the direct link:
https://korzh.com/account/?a={{ contact.email }}Hash
Use the following coupon code on the order form to get the discount: EQANC50

--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library (or corresponding product)
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/account/emailprefs?a={{ contact.email }}Hash

data.Subject: EasyQuery 5.2.0 release. Upgrade discount.
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }}

We are happy to announce the release of version 5.2.0 of EasyQuery! 

Why are we so happy? Because it's a long-awaited merge of 2 our main branches: version 3.x (for .NET Framework 4) and version 5.x branch for .NET Core.

What does it mean for you as a user:

1. All editions (ASP.NET 4, ASP.NET Core, WinForms and WPF) are based on the same code base. It means fewer errors and faster fixes and updates.

2. All EasyQuery assemblies are distributed via NuGet now. No need to download and run some setup file. The practice which was good in the 1990s but is rather outdated now. :)
To use your license - you just need a special license key which is literally one line of code in your program. The key can be acquired in the Client's Area of our website at any time.

3. All web editions of EasyQuery (ASP.NET 4 MVC, ASP.NET WebForms, and ASP.NET Core) use now the same client-side library EasyQuery.JS which is quite modern, written on TypeScript and distributed via NPM. Again, it means fewer bugs and quicker response to any possible problem or feature request.

4. All sample projects are available on GitHub now: https://github.com/easyquery
There are 2 repositories. The first one contains the samples for .NET Framework 4 editions (WPF, WinForms, ASP.NET) and the second - for ASP.NET Core.

For more information about the new version please read the "Version 5.2 release notes" article on our website.
https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/version-5-2  
and the upgrade instructions:
https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/upgrade-instructions/net4-editions-from-3-x-to-5-x

NB:
To celebrate this major update we would like to offer a "no penalty" price for software maintenance renewal to all EasyQuery users who missed their expiration dates for the renewal some time ago and now would like to upgrade to the latest version. To get the original price you don't need to do something special. Just initiate the renewal on your Client's Area page (https://korzh.com/account). 
The offer ends on August 24, 2019. 

--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library (or corresponding product)
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/account/emailprefs?a={{ contact.email }}Hash

data.Subject: New product: EasyQuery.JS
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }},

You use (or used to use) EasyQuery library. We humbly hope that you like it and your customers are happy with it as well.

Now we are glad to announce our new product - EasyQuery.JS. It's a JavaScript library that allows you to embed advanced search and/or data-filtering functionality into any web application.

Just imagine: you can use all the power of EasyQuery UI with any server-side platform or framework like PHP, Node.JS, Java, etc. So if you or your colleagues develop web applications and use some non-.NET backend platform - this product is what you need.

For more information - please visit EasyQuery.JS web page: https://korzh.com/easyquery/javascript 

--
Best regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library.
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/unsubscribe?email={{ contact.email }}

data.Subject: EasyQuery.NET 5.3 + EasyQuery.JS 6.0 release
data.Content:
Dear {{ contact.name }}

We are happy to announce the release of version 5.3 of EasyQuery for .NET together with version 6.0 of EasyQuery.JS! 

Here is a shortlist of the changes made in these releases:

1. EasyQuery.JS is a separate product now

EasyQuery.JS now can be used separately from EasyQuery.NET and has two main editions: Community (free, LGPL-3.0 license) and Enterprise (more features than in Community editions, needs a license key to operate correctly).

The license for EasyQuery for ASP.NET (Core) now includes Enterprise edition of EasyQuery.JS as well, so you can find the license key for it in your Client’s Area Dashboard (https://korzh.com/account)

2. JQuery is not needed anymore

Before version 6.0 EasyQuery.JS required JQuery and JQuery UI libraries for basic DOM operations and rendering of UI widgets. Now those dependencies have gone. You no longer need to include JQuery on your webpages or to reference its packages in your web app. 

Despite such significant changes in EasyQuery.JS, the upgrade process is rather simple. You just need to throw away JQuery (except the case if you need it for some purpose in your project) and add one line of code (to set the license key). You will find the upgrade instructions in the release notes (see the link below).

3. Few small improvements in EasyQuery.NET

 * Better support for SQLite and PostgreSQL
 * Automatic processing of multi-reference between 2 tables
 * Better table joining algorithm

For more information, please read the "release notes" article:
https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/version-5-3

All sample projects are available on GitHub as usual: https://github.com/easyquery

--
Kind regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery
 
P.S.
You have received this message as a registered user of EasyQuery library (or corresponding product)
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/account/emailprefs?a={{ contact.email }}Hash

data.Subject: EasyReport web-service release
data.Content:
Easy.Report (https://easy.report) can be considered as a comprehensive live demo of the features provided by EasyQuery library.    
It's web-service that allows you to connect to your own databases, build simple reports and export the results to CSV or Excel (via HTML). You can also add more users to your team account and share your reports among them.  
The service is free for the moment. We also plan to release its stand-alone version as an ASP.NET Core 2.x application which you will be able can use as a template for your own projects. 
Let us know if you are interested and we will send you a special offer this new product.

Hello {{ contact.name }},

COVID-19 and quarantine measures affect a lot of businesses around the world.

Times are hard for us all. Realizing this, we decided to drop prices for the EasyQuery library making them 35% smaller. If you ever thouhgt about purchasing EasyQuery - this is probably the best time to do it.

data.Subject: EasyQuery.JS 6.0 and maintenance subscription offer
data.Content:
Hello {{ contact.name }},

We have great news about EasyQuery library that we would like to share with you. 

1. EasyQuery.JS 6.0

In a few next days we are going to release a big update to the client-side part of the EasyQuery library - EasyQuery.JS 6.0. 

The client-side part was completely redesigned in the upcoming new version. Now it could be used as a separate library on any platform (not only with a .NET back-end). The visual part does not depend on JQuery anymore and can be easily integrated with other frameworks and libraries (Angular, React, Vue) and third-party visual components (charts, grids, etc).
The latest BETA version is already published and you can test with our ASP.NET Core samples:
https://github.com/easyquery/AspNetCoreSamples/tree/eqjs-6.0.0


2. 50% discount on subscription renewal

We know that you own an EasyQuery license with an expired software maintenance subscription. To celebrate this major release we would like to offer you to renew it for ONLY A HALF of the usual price. With an active subscription you will get the new version for free right after the release. 

To take advantage of this offer - just sign in to your account on Korzh.com (https://korzh.com/account). If you don’t remember the password, you may reset it right on the sign-in page. Then find your license for EasyQuery and click on the “Renew Subscription” link there.

This offer is valid through November 30. After that date, the regular price will apply.
--
Kind regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery

data.Subject: {{ product.name }}: subscription expiration reminder
data.Content:
Hello {{ contact.name }},

As you probably know we provide annual subscriptions for our products to give you access to the latest releases and support.

Your subscription for {{ product.name }} is about to expire on {{ license.expired }}. 
Up to this date, you are able to renew the subscription by the low price (about 25% of the original product price). 
Of course, you will be able to renew the expired subscription after that date (so-called "welcome back"), but it will cost you more than twice as much (about 70%).

To renew your subscription please visit Client's Area of our website: https://korzh.com/account
You will see the list of licenses you have. Click on "Renew" link for the necessary license, then fill the order form and click "Submit Order".

Please note: you will possibly be asked to sign in to access this page. Use your email address and the password you got in the product registration message. 

We tried to answer your prospective questions in the section below. Feel free to ask any additional questions to techsupport@korzh.com.

[Questions & Answers]

Q: Why do I need to renew the subscription?
A: Valid subscription allows you to download new versions of the Product. When the new version is released you don't need to pay for the upgrade - just download it from our Members Area.

Q: Do I lose the right to use the Product if the subscription is expired?
A: No. Your license is perpetual.

Q: What do I lose letting the subscription to expire?
A: With the expired subscription you will no longer have access to new releases and support. 
You will be able to renew the expired subscription (so-called "welcome back"), but it will cost you more than twice as much.

Q: What is the end date of regular (cheap) subscription renewal?
A: The renewal should be done before the subscription expiration date. You can find the expiration date on the Licenses page of our Members Area.
The purchased Product gets the one-year subscription starting from the purchase date. Each renewal adds one year to the current covered period.

Q: What is the end date of "welcome back" (more expensive) subscription renewal?
A: There is no final date. You can do it anytime. 

--
Best regards, {{ product.name }} team.
https://korzh.com

P.S.
You received this message as a registered user of {{ product.name }}. 
If you don't want to receive such emails from us further - please use the following link to unsubscribe:
https://korzh.com/unsubscribe?email={{ contact.email }}

Korzh.com Signup Confirmation

EasyQuery version 7.0 release
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %}
{% markdown p_style: test_style %}

Dear {{ contact.name }}

We are happy to announce the next major update of EasyQuery library - version 7.0 (NB: the latest update is 7.0.1 already). 
Both EasyQuery .NET packages and JS scripts were updated and now have the synchronized version number. 

This release is more about code refactoring and unification of EasyQuery's APIs than new features (however, you will see plenty of them too), 
so the upgrade of your codebase to version 7.0 is highly recommended. 
All [our examples](https://github.com/easyquery/DotNetSamples) were upgraded to 7.0 already and we plan to completely update code examples and tutorials in our documentation within the next 1-2 months.

For more information about the release please refer to the [Release Notes](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/release-notes/version-7-0). 
You can take a look at [Changelog](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/changelog) document for the full list of changes. And here you can find the detailed [upgrade instructions](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/upgrade-instructions/version-7-0).

Please [let us know](https://korzh.com/support) if you have any questions or comments about this release.

--    
Kind regards, EasyQuery team.
https://korzh.com/easyquery

{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: EasyQuery first steps
data.Content:
{% assign text_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px; margin-block-start: 1em; margin-block-end: 1em;' %} {% markdown p_style: text_style, li_style: text_style %}

Hello {{ contact.name }},

Congratulations! Your trial period for EasyQuery framework has been started.

Here are some guidelines on how to get started using EasyQuery in your project(s). To simplify the adaptation process we have split the whole instruction on several small steps so you could get a working project on each of these steps.

  1. Choose your scenario and try the sample project

    EasyQuery can help you to implement several different scenarios of working with data in your app.

    It can be a page for advanced search, data filtering functionality on your CRUD page, or a full-scale solution for ad-hoc reporting. We have sample projects for each of these different scenarios in our GitHub repository with EasyQuery samples.

    So, the best way to start is to choose the one that suits your requirements the most, and then to install and run the corresponding sample project.

  2. Modify the sample to make it work with your data

    The next step will be to modify the sample so it could work with your data model and your database. This process is described in detail in this article.

  3. Move the code to your project

    When you get a working application that implements the necessary scenario and already uses your data, you can just copy/paste the implementation to your project. The following article describes the steps you need to do for that.

Some useful links that may help you in the process:

  • EasyQuery documentation and tutorials
  • Your account page on Korzh.com website. Here you can find all information about your license, as well as the links to the documentation (including this guide and demos.
  • Support request form for your questions or suggestions. We will be glad to help you.
  • EasyQuery's account on Twitter. Follow it to get the latest updates instantly.

Welcome on board!

Kind regards, EasyQuery team
{% endmarkdown %}

data.Subject: Easy Report Starter Kit first steps
Complete registration on Korzh.com
Sign in to Korzh.com
EasyReport Starter Kit download
EasyReport Starter Kit download
ERSK version 3.0 release. 20% off for EasyQuery users
data.Content:
{% assign test_style = 'color: #3A3F46; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;' %} {% markdown p_style: test_style %}

Hello {{ contact.name }},

We are glad to announce the major (v3.0) update of our [Easy Report Start Kit](https://korzh.com/ersk) solution template that may be of interest to you as a current user of EasyQeery for ASP.NET (Core). Easy Report Starter Kit (ERSK) is a base template for __data visualization__ and __ad-hoc reporting__ solution on ASP.NET Core. It comes with full source code and includes the most required features for this kind of solution such as: * authentication * user management * multi-tenancy * report management * data search/filtering * data export (CSV, PDF, Excel) * job scheduling ERSK is built with a Clean Architecture approach and SOLID design principles in mind and uses the latest LTS version of .NET (6.0). Besides, it's possible to re-target it for .NET 5 or .NET Core 3.1. With version 3.0 we also introduce ERSK Community which is a totally free edition of ERSK with only basic features. So, there is no need to build everything from scratch anymore! With ERSK you can deliver a working solution to your client right from Day 1. For more information or to download ERSK Community, please visit the [ERSK web page](https://korzh.com/ersk).
Kind regards, EasyReport Starter Kit team
{% endmarkdown %}
